column4: howdy... my apt-get update seems to fail with a crap ton of 404's, every time.   someone suggested updating their ".list" file but i'm not sure how to do that, where it lives, or what to put in it.
http://fpaste.org/TBHK/raw/
also this is a remote system so i can't really use any UI :(   anyone have any advice?
what version of Ubuntu?
not sure if that gives all the info you need
just did a uname -a
lsb_release -a. I'm looking for a yy.mm version number
so, therefore, no more updates are available?
correct, and the repositories are moved off the mirrors
9.04 went EOL in October, to be precise
makes sense... i don't control the server 100% though and can't go be doing upgrades ;)  guess i need to go yell at a friend. heh.
is it safe to do aptitude install update-manager-core?  it alerts me that it is an untrusted version. How can I find out where aptitude is pulling from?
change your sources.list as the page says, then sudo aptitude update, then move on to installing update-manager-core
which page says this? Sorry, I must have found the wrong page via my googles
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EOLUpgrades is the relevant page, but it doesn't mention sudo aptitude update for some reason.
thanks so much, you guys are greate
urlin2u   this is my sources.list   http://fpaste.org/paY5/raw/
do you have any ideas? I've updated the sources.list file to include the old-releases urls, and then when i attempt to install the update-manager-core, it tells me it is insecure
did you do sudo aptitude update?
thanks. I did not. It was not listed on the page between updating the sources.list and trying to install update-manager-core.  Thanks again.
hey just wanted to say thanks for the point ot the doc.  I didn't end up upgrading but using the old repos allowed me to get the few packages I needed to get through
